data.title: Board of Education
data.meta_description: The Centerville Board of Education is made up of five elected citizens who are residents of Centerville-Washington Township.
data.text:
Board of Education work sessions are typically held on the third Monday of each month, beginning at 6:30 p.m. in the South Unit Commons at Centerville High School. These meetings are open to the public.

Regular meetings are typically held on the fourth Monday of each month, beginning at 7 p.m. in the South Unit Commons at Centerville High School. These meetings are open to the public. They also are recorded, and the video is available on the local cable channel as well as the district's YouTube channel.

Upcoming meeting dates, times, and locations are listed below. A link to the agenda for each meeting will be added to the appropriate date on the calendar as the event date nears. Hard copies of the agenda are also available at each meeting.

The Board of Education provides an opportunity for public comment at their meetings. The policy regarding public participation includes the following guidelines:

Attendees must register their intention to participate in the public participation portion of the meeting in writing prior to the board meeting. A sign-up sheet for public participation will be available 30 minutes prior to each meeting.

Individuals may not register others to speak during public participation.

Participants must first be recognized by the presiding officer and will be requested to preface their comments by an announcement of their name and whether the participant is a resident or non-resident, and if, appropriate, their group affiliation.

During the portion of the meeting designated for public participation, no participant may speak more than once.

As a reminder, all who speak must limit their comments to no more than three minutes, and the Hearing of the Public is limited to a total of 30 minutes. The board will listen to all who speak, but generally not engage in discussion or dialogue. Matters requiring follow-up will be directed to the superintendent. Individual board members can be contacted for a set meeting appointment, and written correspondence can be mailed to the board office.

Additional information about Public Participation at Board Meetings is available by searching for PO 0169.1 in the Board Policy Manual.

Per board policy, members of the Centerville Board of Education should not have any direct or indirect financial interest in a contract with the district; nor furnish directly any labor, equipment or supplies to the district; nor be employed by the board in any capacity for compensation.

In the event a board member is employed by a corporation or business that furnishes goods or services to Centerville Schools, that board member shall declare his/her association with the organization and refrain from debating or voting upon the question of the contract.

Additional information about Conflict of Interest is available by searching for PO 0141.2 in the Board Policy Manual.
